pros: Good Team mates, will help when needed

pros: Nice facility, good food, bad managers
cons: Non-supportive environment. Several bullies employed here, protected by management, HR. Although there are several competent, supportive ancillary staff here, the old hospital crew can be hostile, mean, demeaning and interrupt work flow. Management does not care. The bullies are allowed to continue, despite their harassing and intimidating behavior while management allows good, empathetic, goal oriented employees to leave... in droves! I get anxious just thinking about ever having to walk through those doors again, for any reason. It has been the absolute worst 5 years of my life. I had to attend counseling sessions to learn how to cope...HR did not care. At all. One bully was caught red handed, stealing from another employee, caught sleeping on the job, was instrumental in creating a hostile environment by mobbing, causing many new employees to quit... and is STILL employed there! I would not recommend any colleagues to apply at Peterson nor would I ever apply again, myself. I have been in healthcare for over 20 years and after my experience at Peterson, have left the medical field all together.

pros: Good pay And good benefits
cons: There is High patient turn over

job_title: Administrative Assistant for Care Coordination in Kerrville, TX
pros:
The culture at Peterson is so positive and caring.  I have never experienced anything like it at any previous job.  

On a daily basis I see my fellow employees serving our patients and community to their best ability.  And they demonstrate caring towards each other as well.  I am thankful to work with such positive people.  I can't think of one department in this organization that doesn't have great people in it!
cons:
As corny as it sounds,  the positive culture here at Peterson can make other places a disappointment - lol!  

Whether it's the grocery store, department store, a restaurant, etc.  -  when I encounter negative people and bad service it is a true surprise because I am surrounded by quite the opposite in my work environment.

review_title: Absolutely a wonderful place to work!
job_title: Medical Staff Specialist in Kerrville, TX
pros: Morale is high. Administration sees employees as the real driving force to the success of the hospital.  Patients are respected.  Co-workers are encouraged to pat each other on the back.  Thank you notes are sent regularly to recognize compliments from co-workers.  It's just a great environment.
cons: When you're working for the best, it's easy to forget how bad some people really have it and to take things for granted (especially in a small town like Kerrville).

pros: friendly caring staff, good pay, employee discounts, payroll deduction, behavioral standards that encourage teamwork, respect, and strong ethics; supervisors and managers listen to staff suggestions for improvement, flexible scheduling, Paid Time Off, Sick Leave, Holiday Pay, night and weekend differential pay, 401K match, Medical benefits, scholarships for healthcare fields, Referral bonuses, organizational focus to deliver the mission of providing exceptional, compassionate, patient-centered care.
cons: understaffing in a few departments, but HR is working on recruiting for those positions.

review_title: Great place to work if you do what you're told.
job_title: Diabetes Education Coordinator in Kerrville, TX
pros: Excellent benefits, good salary,  promotions, career progression encouraged and supported.
cons: Small town hospital. Coming in from outside is hard because everybody knows everybody but no one knows you. Lots of nepotism within the hospital system as a whole.

review_title: Outstanding place to work. I love it!
pros: The management and staff practice what they preach. The goal is patient-centered care and the patient is #1.   As an employee,  you are listened to and valued.
cons: I can’t think of anything except location... but then again, that’s what makes it special. Kerrville is the heart of the hill country. Very beautiful locale.

review_title: Could be a diamond in the Texas Hill Country
